title: Finitely supported group sums - misc additions

blocks.name: gsumsubg
blocks.content: The group sum in a subgroup is the same as the group sum. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 28-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm gsumsubg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, c1), co(c2, cgsu, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, cress, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)))
} = {
  gsumress(hs0, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), c3, universe, c4, c5, cfv(c0g, c0), w0)
  elfvexd(c0, c3, csubg, w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)))
  subgss(c3, c0, cfv(cbs, c0))
  syl(w0, wcel(cfv(c0g, c0), c3), wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)))
  subg0cl(c3, c0, cfv(c0g, c0))
  sylan(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wa(wceq(co(cfv(c0g, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0)), cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, cgrp))
  syl(w0, wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)))
  subgrcl(c3, c0)
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wceq(co(cfv(c0g, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0)), cv(hs0)))
  grplid(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(c0g, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0))
  grprid(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cplusg, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm gsumsubg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[gsum]c1)=(c2[gsum]c1))
  ⊣ c2 =(c0[|`s]c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c1 : c4 → c3))
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
} = {
  gsumress(hs0, c0, c1, c2, (Base ` c0), (+ ` c0), c3, universe, c4, c5, (0 ` c0), w0)
  elfvexd(c0, c3, csubg, w0)
  syl(w0, c3 ⊆(Base ` c0), c3 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
  subgss(c3, c0, (Base ` c0))
  syl(w0, (0 ` c0)∈ c3, c3 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
  subg0cl(c3, c0, (0 ` c0))
  sylan(w0, hs0 ∈(Base ` c0), (((0 ` c0)[(+ ` c0)]hs0)= hs0 ∧(hs0[(+ ` c0)](0 ` c0))= hs0), c0 ∈ Grp)
  syl(w0, c0 ∈ Grp, c3 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
  subgrcl(c3, c0)
  jca((c0 ∈ Grp ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), ((0 ` c0)[(+ ` c0)]hs0)= hs0, (hs0[(+ ` c0)](0 ` c0))= hs0)
  grplid(c0, hs0, (Base ` c0), (0 ` c0), (+ ` c0))
  grprid(c0, hs0, (Base ` c0), (+ ` c0), (0 ` c0))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  eqid((+ ` c0))
  eqid((0 ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c((Base ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c((+ ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c((0 ` c0))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: gsumsra
blocks.content: The group sum in a subring algebra is the same as the ring's group sum. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 28-May-2023.)

blocks.name: gsumle
blocks.content: A finite sum in an ordered monoid is monotonic. This proof would be much easier in an ordered group, where an inverse element would be available. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Mar-2018.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: gsummpt2co
blocks.content: Split a finite sum into a sum of a collection of sums over disjoint subsets. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Mar-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm gsummpt2co(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c2)), co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s1, c3, co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, cima(ccnv(c4), csn(cv(s1))), c2))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c7))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c2, c5))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c8, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpt(s0, c1, c8))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c2)), co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s1, c3, co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, cima(ccnv(c4), csn(cv(s1))), c2)))))), diffsc(s1, c1))

blocks.name: gsummpt2d
blocks.content: Express a finite sum over a two-dimensional range as a double sum. See also ~ gsum2d . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: gsumvsca2
blocks.content: Scalar product of a finite group sum for a left module over a semiring. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Mar-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm gsumvsca2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, co(c2, c3, c4))), co(co(c5, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c2)), c3, c4)))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(csca, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvsca, c0))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cplusg, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c9, cfv(cbs, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cslmd))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c2, c9))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c9)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpancom(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, co(c2, c3, c4))), co(co(c5, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c2)), c3, c4)), wcel(c1, cfn))

blocks.name: lmodvslmhm
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication in a left module by a fixed element is a group homomorphism. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: Pull a scalar multiplication out of a sum of vectors. This theorem properly generalizes ~ gsummulc1 , since every ring is a left module over itself. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Jun-2023.)

thm gsumvsmul1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {

thm gsummptres(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  eqtrd(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c2)), co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, cin(c1, c3), c2)), co(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, cin(c1, c3), c2)), cfv(cplusg, c0), co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, cdif(c1, c3), c2))), w0)

blocks.name: xrge0tsmsbi
blocks.content: Any limit of a finite or infinite sum in the nonnegative extended reals is the union of the sets limits, since this set is a singleton. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Jun-2017.)

thm xrge0tsmsbi(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, ctsu, c2)), wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c3, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))
} = {
  syl6bbr(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, ctsu, c2)), wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), wcel(c0, csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, ctsu, c2), csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), w0)
  sylib(w0, wceq(co(c1, ctsu, c2), csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))), wbr(co(c1, ctsu, c2), cen, c1o))
  syl2anc(w0, wbr(co(c1, ctsu, c2), cen, c1o), wcel(c3, c4), wf(c2, c3, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))
  xrge0tsms2(c3, c4, c2, c1)
  en1b(co(c1, ctsu, c2))
  impbii(wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), wcel(c0, csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))))
  ibir(wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), wcel(c0, csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))))
  syl(wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), wb(wcel(c0, csn(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))), wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpbiri(wceq(c0, cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cuni(co(c1, ctsu, c2)), universe))
  uniex(co(c1, ctsu, c2))
